comment_text: So cool!  Nice job Matt and Katy and Science Channel!  It's a shame there isn't any audio of the scarecrow wheels clawing over rocks for comparison to recent Perseverance audio
Why it has to use wheels to navigate over sand?
Thats pretty cool, I like to think I know a lot about current day space travel but I have NEVER heard about "Scarecrow". Neat
I knew there were 2 versions but not 3.  How awesome to see it trying to navigate here on earth.
wtf. that thing is huge. I thought it was going to be smaller.
Science channel, i believe the bizarre grid in china from "what on earth" is a mirror image of the streets of d.c.... please look into this.
Well, now I know that there is such thing as a Mars yard...
I would rather give my social security tax to NASA
